author: Special Correspondent
text:
Blacktopping of a stretch of the Tiruchi-Chennai National Highway in progress near Tiruchi on Thursday.— PHOTO: B. VELANKANNI RAJ

The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has taken up work on strengthening the Tiruchi–Chennai National Highway, as part of its maintenance.

The maintenance of the National Highway, particularly the erstwhile Grand Southern Trunk (GST) road needs periodical maintenance, said an official source.

At present, the NHAI has taken up maintenance work to a stretch of 654 metres between Sand Reach area and the Number One Toll Gate on the Tiruchi– Chennai National Highway.

The current maintenance is executed at an estimate of Rs. 1 crore.

“The NHAI has been monitoring the safety of the roads and has been taking up maintenance work,” the official added. The current work is executed in two phases.

The old road was carved out before filling it up with new gravel.
title: NHAI strengthens Tiruchi–Chennai highway
